conclusion: State A: p = 3 × 10⁵ Pa, V = 1 × 10⁻³ m³; State C: p = 1 × 10⁵ Pa, V = 4 × 10⁻³ m³
Temperature at state A is −73 °C = 200 K
Use the ideal-gas equation n = pV/RT at A to find the amount of gas (number of moles)
Internal energy change from A to C is ΔU = +200 J
cᵥ for a mono-atomic ideal gas is (3/2)R
Solve ΔT = ΔU / (n cᵥ) and add to Tₐ to obtain T𝒞
Calculate n = pₐVₐ / (R Tₐ) = (3.0 × 10⁵ Pa)(1.0 × 10⁻³ m³) / (8.31 J mol⁻¹ K⁻¹ · 200 K) ≈ 1.8 × 10⁻¹ mol
Calculate T𝒞 = Tₐ + ΔT = 200 K + 90 K = 290 K
